newsitem.title: ITALY: PRESS DIGEST - Italy - Monday February 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Italy - Monday February 10.

text.p: Following are some of the top headlines in leading Italian newspapers.

* Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi said: "It is in Rome and not in Berlin that we have to discuss pensions," replying to Bank of Italy Governor Antonio Fazio and Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi. Fazio and Ciampi speaking at the G7 summit in Berlin said European countries cannot afford to delay reforming their welfare system any longer (all).
* In an interview PDS leader Massimo D'Alema said: "Pensions will not be touched until 1998 but we should start discussing the welfare state with unions right now." (Il Messaggero).
* Italian EU commissioner Mario Monti said it is necessary to make sure the 1997 budget is respected before considering bringing forward the 1998 budget (all).
* After a 24-hour rail strike paralysed Italy's train network on Sunday, post offices will remain closed today as a protest against cost cutting measures included in the 1997 budget (all).
Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
